SENT.plain: The prolonged seizures of status epilepticus produce chronic arrhythmogenic changes in cardiac function
This study was designed to determine if repeated, self-limiting seizures administered to kindled rats induce similar cardiac dysfunction
Multiple seizures administered to rats following hippocampal kindling resulted in cardiac QT interval prolongation and increased susceptibility to experimental arrhythmias
These data suggest that multiple, self-limiting seizures of intractable epilepsy may have cardiac effects that can contribute to sudden unexpected death in epilepsy (SUDEP)
